alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 1:44PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Yukon River between Tanana and the Nowitna River. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the Yukon River between Tanana and Nowitna River, and minor flooding of the lower Nowitna River. Flooding of low lying roads in Tanana is occuring and will continue this weekend. Water levels are expected to remain steady or rise slightly this weekend. Some areas of ponded water will see water remain for a number of days. Locations that have ice onshore will have that ice remain for days until it melts. Water levels along the river will fall slowly when the ice jam breaks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1220 PM AKDT Saturday, The River Watch Team reports that the portion of the ice jam on the Yukon River from the mouth of the Nowitna River to the Kokrine Bible Camp remains in place. Water continues to flow over the banks in that area and into the lower Nowitna River. Water also remains backed up and overbank along the Yukon River upstream as far as Tanana. When the ice broke loose on Friday evening, it was apparently only the half of the jam that was downstream of the Nowitna River. This means that water levels along the Yukon from Tanana to the Nowitna River and along the lower Nowitna River will remain steady or rise slightly this weekend. Extensive flooding formed a large lake along and upstream of where the ice jam is. Satellite imagery shows that flooding was occuring 20 to 30 miles up the Nowitna River, and along the Yukon River from the Nowitna River upstream to Tanana. In Tanana, minor flooding of low lying roads is occuring. The ice jam is expected to break later this weekend. Water will slowly drain back into the river once the jam breaks. Some poorly drained areas will keep water for many days. Ice that is up on shore will remain for many days until it melts. - - For Tanana: At 4:00pm Friday the stage was 86.64 feet. Flood Stage is 86.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River between the Nowitna River and Tanana, or along the lower Nowitna River, take action to protect yourself from flooding. Water may remain high in poorly drained areas many days.
